name: Cozy sailboat in urban harbor
summary: Enjoy our cozy sailboat and enjoy the skyline views. We're moored in a quiet harbor next to Chicago's Museum Campus and Soldier Field late April thru October. Ask about our pre-season booking discount for the 2018 season!
space: The boat offers a convertible main salon and two berths, a limited galley, and the deck for relaxation and lounging.  The skyline views are fantastic both day and night. The outdoor speakers will broadcast either radio or your device. The Navy Pier fireworks are in view on Wednesday and Saturday nights.
description: Enjoy our cozy sailboat and enjoy the skyline views. We're moored in a quiet harbor next to Chicago's Museum Campus and Soldier Field late April thru October. Ask about our pre-season booking discount for the 2018 season! The boat offers a convertible main salon and two berths, a limited galley, and the deck for relaxation and lounging.  The skyline views are fantastic both day and night. The outdoor speakers will broadcast either radio or your device. The Navy Pier fireworks are in view on Wednesday and Saturday nights. You have access to the whole boat and its adjacent dock. Feel free to store your perishables in the fridge. In addition to the on-board 'head', more traditional facilities, including showers and laundry, are a short walk away. If you have a vehicle, we have a parking pass for the lot just outside the dock. We will conduct in-person check ins and go over everything you need to know.  We're close by so feel free to call if you have any questions. We are a 10 minute walk
notes: It is a rather high step up to get on/off board and then down into the cabin. If you're lacking agility and can't make the step up or the small jump down then this might not be the right place for your stay.  Bottled water is provided.
transit: We are a 10 minute walk to the Field Museum where many cabs are available, a 15-20 minute walk to south Michigan Ave for several CTA bus routes, and another block further to the 'el' trains. There are also 2-3 nearby Divvy stations where bikes are available for rent.
access: You have access to the whole boat and its adjacent dock. Feel free to store your perishables in the fridge. In addition to the on-board 'head', more traditional facilities, including showers and laundry, are a short walk away. If you have a vehicle, we have a parking pass for the lot just outside the dock.
interaction: We will conduct in-person check ins and go over everything you need to know.  We're close by so feel free to call if you have any questions.
house_rules: 1. No smoking, no exceptions. 2. The head is delicate... Do not put anything in that you haven't eaten plus 4 squares of TP at one time. 3. The stove is not available for use. 4. Please do not entertain more than 10 people, including those in your party.
host_about: Sailor girl that loves travel, food, wine and people!

name: Lake Front Home
summary: In the southern tip of the south loop of Chicago, a lively neighborhood half mile from McCormick Convention Center and minutes away from Downtown main attractions, parks, Soldier Field, Millennium Park, etc.  Beautiful views of Lake Michigan and the city, spacious, and sophisticated condominium for you and your family.  Uniquely situated in a quiet and beautiful part of town with tree lined streets yet, only steps away from the great activities of Chicago with wonderful restaurants.
space: This space is perfect for business associates attending nearby conferences, especially at the McCormick Place, as well as the newly built Marriott Hotel, etc. Also perfect for a couple or family looking for a getaway without being in the middle of the hustle and bustle of downtown, but being just close enough to enjoy all of what downtown Chicago offers.  We love our space and we hope you do too!

name: Adeline's Sea Moose, 68 ft luxury yacht, sleeps 6
summary: Adeline's Sea Moose is a 68 foot luxury Chris Craft Yacht docked in Burnham Harbor, just a few steps from downtown Chicago. She comfortably hosts up to 6 guests, and is the perfect opportunity to experience summertime in Chicago!
space: When you sleep aboard Adeline's Sea Moose you have private access to the entire vessel. The yacht stays moored to the dock at all times, and you are welcome to come and go as you please. There are 3 state rooms (1 master with queen bed and private bath, 2 additional state rooms each with 2 twin beds and shared full bath) There is also access to crew quarters with an additional bed and bath. All bathrooms are stocked with L'Occitane en Provence products and you are greeted with a complimentary welcome aboard basket. Kitchen is stocked with fresh fruit, champagne with fresh squeezed orange juice for morning mimosas, and local intelligentsia coffee.

Kitchen is stocked with fresh fruit, champagne with fresh squeezed orange juice for morning mimosas, and local intelligentsia coffee. Guests are welcome to use entire yacht, and are able to come and go as they please. If you are interested in charte
neighborhood_overview: Docked at Burnham Harbor and within 1 mile walking distance of Adler Planetarium, Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum, Soldier Field and Northerly Island. McCormick Place, Arie Crown Theater, Grant Park, Art Institute, Millennium Park and Navy Pier are within 2 miles.
transit: We provide 1 parking pass to the Burnham Harbor parking lot...which is just 20 feet away from the dock. Of course being in downtown Chicago, public transportation is everywhere!
access: Guests are welcome to use entire yacht, and are able to come and go as they please. If you are interested in chartering or having an event, let us know any we would gladly share our pricing and policies.
interaction: Adeline's crew is available to help at any time during your stay.
house_rules: - Yacht remains docked at all times - Quiet Hours after 10pm - No additional guests allowed aboard - Check in/out will be confirmed the week of depending on other charters. This would need to remain flexible until confirmed. - If you are interested in chartering Adeline's Sea Moose, please let us know and we would be more than happy to send you over more information with pricing. She can comfortably host up to 40 guests during charter events.

name: Beautiful & Spacious Industrial Style Loft
summary: Very spacious 2 bedroom/2 bathroom condo by the lake in the highly desirable Prairie district.  12-foot ceilings, generous room sizes, a separate dining room, and a split floor plan. Large balcony with views of Soldier Field and the Lake. Convenient location near the Lake, parks, museums, transportation, restaurants, and more.

name: Oasis in McCormick
summary: A spacious bedroom with a luxurious king size bed and an exclusive private bathroom. Ideal for guest doing business at McCormick Place.  It's just 15 minutes walk or less than 5 minutes bus ride to McCormick Place. Enjoy the comfort of your home while you are away from home.
space: A spacious bedroom with a luxurious king size bed and an exclusive private bathroom.  Enjoy a magnificent view of Chicago's skyline right from your bedroom window.   Recommendation or positive review from other Airbnb hosts is required.  If the PURPOSE of your visit is other than attending an event at McCormick Place or doing business in the Loop, please inquire before you request a reservation to ensure that my place meets your needs and to clarify any questions you may have about the private room.
description: A spacious bedroom with a luxurious king size bed and an exclusive private bathroom. Ideal for guest doing business at McCormick Place.  It's just 15 minutes walk or less than 5 minutes bus ride to McCormick Place. Enjoy the comfort of your home while you are away from home. A spacious bedroom with a luxurious king size bed and an exclusive private bathroom.  Enjoy a magnificent view of Chicago's skyline right from your bedroom window.   Recommendation or positive review from other Airbnb hosts is required.  If the PURPOSE of your visit is other than attending an event at McCormick Place or doing business in the Loop, please inquire before you request a reservation to ensure that my place meets your needs and to clarify any questions you may have about the private room. Once you have checked-in, you will have 24-hr access in/out of the apartment. Guest will have complimentary access to the living room/kitchen and balcony.  Guest will have access to high speed wifi internet (100+ mbps).
notes: Please present a government issued ID or passport upon check-in. Complimentary bottled water, soda, coffee, tea and fruits are available for the guests. Shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, hair blow dryer, bath robe and towels are provided in the bathroom. Bluetooth Clock Radio with an iPhone charger is provided in the guest room. Free street parking is available within the neighborhood. A fee will apply for each additional guest, for each night of the reservation. If you plan to CHECK-IN after 11 pm, please let me know before you book a reservation. I may accept guest to check-in after 11 pm on Friday and Saturday.
transit: CTA bus #4, and #1 stops are along Michigan Ave. Both routes take you directly to the Loop (Chicago's central business district) in about 15-20 minutes. Bus #4 operates 24/7. Both bus routes take you to Michigan Ave and 23rd street (less than 5 minutes) which is just a block away from the McCormick Center West building entrance. A short 15-minute bus ride to Downtown Chicago, Loop, Millennium Park and Grant Park. Taxi cabs/Uber are available along Michigan Ave.
access: Once you have checked-in, you will have 24-hr access in/out of the apartment. Guest will have complimentary access to the living room/kitchen and balcony.  Guest will have access to high speed wifi internet (100+ mbps). Enjoy watching a smart HDTV in your own bedroom with Hulu Plus and Amazon Prime subscriptions. You may also enjoy watching a 60-inch smart HDTV in the living room. (Note: Cable TV service subscription is not available)  Laundry room in the building with washers and dryers are available for the guest (with applicable fee).
interaction: I'm usually out of the apartment on weekdays from 8am to 6pm. I interact with guest only as needed. However, I will always be available to make your stay as comfortable as possible.
house_rules: Welcome to my home! Please be respectful of my home as you would your own.  NO SMOKING and NO DRINKING OF LIQUOR (distilled beverages) in the apartment/balcony or building. Moderate drinking of wine and beer is allowed.  INTOXICATED guest(s) will be asked to leave the apartment immediately. If you use the kitchen (silverware, plates and other utensils), please clean up after yourself.  IMPORTANT NOTE: A camera is set up in the living room/kitchen for security reasons.  Have a fun, safe and enjoyable visit in Chicago!
host_about: Home-sharing has been an amazing and great experience for me. I enjoy hosting and it has given me a chance to meet new friends from different parts of the country and the world.  I became a Superhost 3 months after hosting.

name: Loft-Style 2BR in South Loop by Sonder
summary: At this Sonder, you'll love the industrial charm, exposed brick, and fully-equipped kitchen. Located in the South Loop, a short walk from the Roosevelt station and Chicago's famous Museum Campus.
space: Every booking is instantly confirmed. Every call or message is answered within minutes. Every home is equipped with crisp linens, high-speed Wi-Fi, and kitchen and bath essentials—everything you need for an exceptional stay.
description: At this Sonder, you'll love the industrial charm, exposed brick, and fully-equipped kitchen. Located in the South Loop, a short walk from the Roosevelt station and Chicago's famous Museum Campus. Every booking is instantly confirmed. Every call or message is answered within minutes. Every home is equipped with crisp linens, high-speed Wi-Fi, and kitchen and bath essentials—everything you need for an exceptional stay. Our concierge is available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay. There's plenty to offer within walking distance. Try out Exchequer Restaurant & Pub or Gino’s East South Loop for some of Chicago's best dining. For shopping, head to Roosevelt Collection Shops. To explore the rest of the city, grab the bus at State & 16th Street just a few feet away. The South Loop is a vibrant blend of downtown Chicago with an emerging residential
neighborhood_overview: There's plenty to offer within walking distance. Try out Exchequer Restaurant & Pub or Gino’s East South Loop for some of Chicago's best dining. For shopping, head to Roosevelt Collection Shops. To explore the rest of the city, grab the bus at State & 16th Street just a few feet away. The South Loop is a vibrant blend of downtown Chicago with an emerging residential neighborhood. Alongside delicious local restaurants taking over Michigan Avenue, we've watched new businesses and highrises spring to life over the past decade. This dynamic location has quickly become one of the hottest markets in the city. Home to Chicago's largest tourist attractions, the lakefront Museum Campus and Grant Park, visitors and locals enjoy spending a day at the Adler Planetarium, Shedd Aquarium, and Field Museum.
notes: Vacation Rental License No.: R (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)  Due to new development, you may encounter some construction that may be audible from your Sonder during business hours from 8:00AM to 4:30PM. Due to nearby train tracks, you may experience some noise. The second bedroom of this Sonder is loft-style, where the walls start below the ceiling, and you must walk up 5 stairs to access this room. This Sonder offers a complimentary ROKU streaming device with Netflix as well as access to many other apps. It also includes 40+ HD basic channels. Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox and we'll be sending you detailed access information three days before your stay. If you need any help, just give us a call.
transit: There are minimal free street parking spots available. Drivers can also find paid street and parking lot options nearby, but please be mindful of street signs.
interaction: Our concierge is available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay.
house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. It may be possible to obtain permission to host a party; contact our team to learn more.  7. If a location is lef
host_about:
Sonder provides everything you need for an exceptional stay. Every booking is instantly confirmed. Every call or message is answered within minutes. Every home is equipped with crisp linens, high-speed Wi-Fi, and kitchen and bath essentials. And every experience is one-of-a-kind, thanks to our unique spaces and Neighborhood Guides.

name: Charming Museum Park Town House
summary: This lovely and spacious 3 bedroom townhouse has comfort, space, beauty, and the best location in the city. The neighborhood is hip and fun and the 2100 square foot house has everything you need including a large rooftop deck and an upgraded kitchen.
space: Come stay at our lovely 4-floor townhouse, right in the heart of Chicago's South Loop. 3 large bedrooms: 1 w/ king-size bed, 1 w/ full Murphy bed, 1 w/ bunk beds (2), and 1 queen air mattress in the den (private; outside of common living room area). 3 full baths, 1 with Jacuzzi tub, 1 with large soaking tub. The living room and the 4th floor den each have couches, TV and fireplaces.  Great view of the the city's skyline from the rooftop deck off the 4th floor den. There is also a small deck off the kitchen with a hammock, 2 lounging chairs, and a table with chairs. The ground-floor patio in the front has a rocking chair for 2--great for picnicking and people-watching. Gorgeous, open-plan kitchen with upgraded appliances throughout (Wolf Range, refrigerator, dishwasher, food warmer, washer/dryer).
description: This lovely and spacious 3 bedroom townhouse has comfort, space, beauty, and the best location in the city. The neighborhood is hip and fun and the 2100 square foot house has everything you need including a large rooftop deck and an upgraded kitchen. Come stay at our lovely 4-floor townhouse, right in the heart of Chicago's South Loop. 3 large bedrooms: 1 w/ king-size bed, 1 w/ full Murphy bed, 1 w/ bunk beds (2), and 1 queen air mattress in the den (private; outside of common living room area). 3 full baths, 1 with Jacuzzi tub, 1 with large soaking tub. The living room and the 4th floor den each have couches, TV and fireplaces.  Great view of the the city's skyline from the rooftop deck off the 4th floor den. There is also a small deck off the kitchen with a hammock, 2 lounging chairs, and a table with chairs. The ground-floor patio in the front has a rocking chair for 2--great for picnicking and people-watching. Gorgeous, open-plan kitchen with upgraded appliances throughout (Wolf Ra
neighborhood_overview: The location cannot be beat! We love living here because we have easy access to the best the city has to offer. Grant park is literally right outside the front door, and has many festivals, like Taste of Chicago, Blues Fest, Jazz Fest, Lollapalooza, and a cool new skate park. Millennium Park is a 15m walk and also has tons of concerts and shows (15 minute walk).  Going south there are many parks and the historical Prairie district with it's lovely mansions and history about 1-10 minute away with lots of greenery.  The closest beach is also a short 10 minute walk away but being so close to the lake we have access to a lot of summer fun on the lake.  There are also many delicious bars and both American and ethnic restaurants in the neighborhood and Chinatown is about a 25 minute walk. The Field museum of Natural History, Shedd aquarium, Planetarium and Lake Michigan are around a 10-20 minutes walk away.  Grant park is a 5 minute walk and the Art Institute is about 15 minutes away.
notes: We have 2 parakeets that will probably be staying with you. We wouldn't need to take care of them since we'll leave plenty of food and water for them. They're quiet at night time and we've never been woken up by the noise. You can cover them with a blanket if you'd like. If it's a problem, we can take them out of the house if you let us know.  If you are interested in a date that is marked unavailable in the calendar, please still contact us.  Maybe we can work something out.
transit: Most places you'd want to go, you can walk: Grant Park, Museum Campus, Art Institute, Millennium Park, Soldier Field, and the El.  Divvy bikeshare bikes are also nearby (2 blocks) and a fun way to get around. Easy access to buses 1, 3, and 4 to Union Station and Magnificent Mile.  If you've got a car, there is easy freeway access: you are 3 blocks from Lake Shore Drive, which connects you right to I-55, McCormick Place, etc.
access: Basically, you'll have access to the whole townhouse, minus some closets and storage spaces. Please enjoy the washer/dryer, the well-equipped kitchen, and an office space if you need to work.
interaction: We will likely be out of town, so interaction will be via e-mail, with clear instructions for picking up / dropping off the keys.
house_rules: We hope you will feel welcome in our family's home. We love having guests, and they always find it welcoming, fun, and comfortable. We hope you will too, and that the same spirit remains in our home.   Smoking/Drinking: We do not allow smoking indoors or underage drinking. Noise: We have never heard our neighbors and I'm sure they've never heard us and we'd like to keep it that way :) Please enjoy your stay but no parties, loud music or pets. Occupancy: We think the house is best suited for a family / group of 4 to 6.  If you are a larger group, please get in touch and we can discuss.
host_about: Bindi is a nutritionist, mom, and likes art/crafts. Avi is a dad, writer, and teacher. Raiva is a 7 year old girl. Rafi is a 5 year old boy. We love to read, travel and nature.

notes: Come tired, leave rejuvenated!

house_rules: ** Spacious N Sunny Condo Rules** Thank you for choosing our home during your visit to Chicago. We hope that you will enjoy your stay. Below you will find the house rules and responsibilities for guests staying in our home. - We expect that you will respect our home.  - Please pick up after yourself in common areas. - We are FIRM with quiet time after 10PM on weeknights.  - No eating meals in the bedroom. - Absolutely NO unregistered guests without prior approval.  - Absolutely NO drug paraphernalia of any kind - alcohol is OK.  - Absolutely NO smoking or incense burning in the house.  - Absolutely NO pets or animals are allowed in the house. - Please always keep the doors locked and be courteous to our neighbors.  - If anything breaks, spills, stains, etc. please let us know ASAP.  - Unreturned and/or lost house keys be charged a $600 replacement fee per HOA rules and regulations.  - Any significant damage will result in the loss of security deposit (Website hidden by Airbnb)  - CHILD

host_about:
My fiancee and I are working-professionals  and are both very friendly and outgoing! We love the outdoors equally as much as we love the "city life"- so if we are not out trying new restaurants, finding festivals, or exploring new parks- you might  find us out running the path (we have both completed several marathons, even an Ironman), biking around town, or even zipping up to WI or MI for some camping. We also love to entertain and consider ourselves to be somewhat "foodies". Brian- who is an excellent cook- even worked with the owner of Grace (3 star Michelin restaurant) at one point in time!

We are looking to host people in our home from all over. We think it will be a great way to meet new and interesting people!

East Pilsen neighborhood known for it's thriving art scene and restaraunts is 1.6 miles away. Common tourist attractions the Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, Soldier Field and Northerly Island are 1.5 miles away.
notes: Being a Chicago native and working/living in almost every neigborhood we could give great itineraries for practically every type of traveler. We both travel frequently and have hosted many guest in our home.
transit: Street parking is non permit, free and easy to find for travelers with cars. Uber is most common to get around. Center of downtown where major shopping, and Millennium Park, Navy Pier average $6 to $8 a ride. Both Green Line and Red Line train are .5 miles away, 10-12 minute walk. There is a bus stop on the corner of the property, the 29 bus runs directly down the popular State street into downtown as well.
interaction: We both work in hospitality so in peak tourist months the condo will more than likely be private to guest at night. We  will be accessible via phone all day and night.
host_about: We frequently travel. Usually travel to experience local culture, dining, and shopping. We mostly go out of town to relax. We work in the hospitality and  nightlife industry, so it's always good to get away and relax.

name: Gorgeous views,  sky-high style!
summary: Rent my lovely flat perched high over Lake Michigan and Chicago landmarks: Museum Campus, Navy Pier, etc. Sweet location in lively S. Loop, walk to the lake, Soldier Field, McCormick Convention Center, and downtown. Laundry, kitchen, & killer views!
space: My home, an unusually nice 18th-floor corner unit: windows from hardwood floor to the high vaulted ceiling, more windows on the south wall bring in sunlight all day, including the kitchen, so amazing sunrises AND sunsets. Large balcony with seriously breathtaking 270º views of Chicago's landmarks, from Millennium Park to  Navy Pier, the Field Museum (plus Schedd Aquarium and Adler Planetarium!), Soldier Field, Komiski Park, Hyde Park and even Gary, Indiana to the south, with tons of beautiful Lake Michigan in between. High ceilings and hardwood floors throughout. And unbeatable location, heart of S. Loop / Central Station, just a few blocks to the Lakefront, Soldier Field or McCormick Place, and 15-20m walk (or $5 Uber) to downtown. 5 minutes walk to the best supermarket in the city. 10 minutes walk to the CTA (subway) and Trader Joe's.  Nice big, fully equipped kitchen with granite counters, stainless fridge, dishwasher, stove, etc. More views of the lake from the bedroom, and a new,

neighborhood_overview: Unbeatable location! Just 3 blocks from Lakefront, which is the key to happiness in Chicago (even in winter). You've got the bike path, museums, Soldier Field, 15th and 35th street beaches, and McCormick place if you are in town for a convention. On the way you pass the old Prairie District, with the oldest and most beautiful houses in Chicago. South Loop is a convenient but unassuming neighborhood-- you are 4 short blocks to Mariano's (great supermarket), and enough cafes, restaurants and bars on Michigan and Wabash to satisfy any taste. 6 blocks to Trader Joe's, Jewel/Osco, and Grant Park.
transit: But the real key is how close you are to downtown and public transit. There are tons of buses right on the corner (Michigan Ave.) that will take you wherever. The nearest "El" (subway) station is 6 blocks away, walkable or get a transfer on the bus (tip: get a CTA transit card and put a little cash on it).  There are also bike-share stations within a few blocks and good bike lanes into downtown, and of course the bike path along the lake which takes you anywhere you want to go: north to Millennium Park and downtown, Navy Pier, and Lincoln Park, or south through the nature park along the lake.   If you've got a car, there is easy freeway access: you are 3 blocks from Lake Shore Drive, which connects you right to I-55, McCormick Place, etc.
access: Basically, you'll have access to the whole apartment, minus some closets and storage spaces. You can use the washer/dryer, the well-equipped kitchen, the stereo, even a large computer monitor and external keyboard for your laptop if you need to work.
interaction: I'm usually traveling so it's likely we won't meet in person. You'll get the key from a lock box outside the apartment. I'll be available via text, phone, or (Hidden by Airbnb) to handle any questions/problems. My cousin lives a few blocks down the street for any emergencies. Yo hablo español (vivi en México, Colombia, y Argentina), pues sean bien-venidos... Falo português também (morei MUITOS anos no Brasil!). Seja bem vindo!
house_rules: This is my home, so please enjoy it and everything in it (books, LPs, musical instruments etc.), but treat it nicely. No parties or strangers, please! It's a quiet building, with pretty good insulation, so you'll have privacy and a peaceful stay; please reciprocate by keeping volumes reasonable and being respectful in hallways, elevators etc.. Sorry, absolutely no pets, and absolutely no smoking inside. You can smoke on the balcony if you keep the sliding door closed and promise not to throw your butts off the railing (people actually do this!).  And be careful on the balcony, it gets windy, don't let stuff, or people, blow off!   It's never happened, but if you lose the key there's a $500 replacement fee. (It's a major hassle.)
host_about: I just started my first "real job" at the tender age of 40: Professor of Political Science at University of Chicago. Before that I lived and worked in South America for more than a decade, as well as Asia and Europe, studying, working for NGOs, trying to be a writer, and lots of other stuff. Love to travel, love to host. I guess if I had to sum up my point of view in a mixed metaphor, it would be "If you go against the grain, there's less traffic."

name: Historic Coach House 3 blocks from McCormick Place
summary: Space This is the 2,500-square-feet coach house to one of the rare 1870s mansions left in Chicago's South Loop, walking distance from the Lake, Museum Campus, Soldier Field, the new DePaul stadium, McCormick Place, Grant Park and downtown. Two queen-sized beds, full kitchen, couch, laundry, two bathrooms, indoor parking off of alley. Two levels. We are only 3 blocks from McCormick Place! This is a private building on a beautiful park, plus access to yard. It is not wheelchair accessible.
space: Full private historic coach house.  Bedrooms are on separate floors with private bathrooms so great for 2 co-workers. Backyard, Full Kitchen, 2 bathrooms, 2 bedrooms. We provide coffee/tea/cream granola bars/snacks. No parties. We also have a beautiful event venue in the front building (75 person capacity) that can be rented for corporate meetings or social events.

neighborhood_overview: We are located on one of the most beautiful, quiet, historic streets in Chicago. There is a beautiful park next door and there is a bridge over to the lakefront. You can walk to Museum campus to see The Field Museum, The Shedd Aquarium and The Adler Planetarium.
notes: Great transportation to downtown, 5-10 minutes away. McCormick Place 3 blocks away.
transit: We have an indoor garage as well as room for one car in the driveway if  needed. There are 3 separate buses that all go downtown and take only 10-15 minutes to get to Grant Park, central downtown.
access: Total stand alone coachhouse, garage parking for 1 car
interaction: We live in main building and so will be nearby if anything needed.
house_rules: - The yard closes 10 p.m., no parties in yard or house.
host_about:
My sister and I have lived here since 1978, and we love our neighborhood. We are LGBT-inclusive and know a lot about the city. I am an event manager and photographer, she is a journalist, and our friends and family live on the property.

Our home is an 1870s Chicago mansion in the South Loop, close to the Lakefront Museum Campus, Soldier Field, McCormick Place and downtown, and easily accessible via public transportation. We open it for events such as historic house walks and occasional art shows. We love being connected to our neighborhood. 

We are on a quiet street next to a park and other historic homes that open for tours. This is a family- and dog-friendly neighborhood.

Come live for a few days in this historic home and explore the beauty of Chicago's South Loop.

Our motto: Live and and LET LIVE!

name: Sleek 2BR in South Loop by Sonder
summary: At this Sonder, you'll love the industrial-style decor, high ceilings, and fully-equipped kitchen with modern appliances. Located in the South Loop, a short walk from the Roosevelt station and Chicago's famous Museum Campus.
space: Every booking is instantly confirmed. Every call or message is answered within minutes. Every home is equipped with crisp linens, high-speed Wi-Fi, and kitchen and bath essentials—everything you need for an exceptional stay.
description: At this Sonder, you'll love the industrial-style decor, high ceilings, and fully-equipped kitchen with modern appliances. Located in the South Loop, a short walk from the Roosevelt station and Chicago's famous Museum Campus. Every booking is instantly confirmed. Every call or message is answered within minutes. Every home is equipped with crisp linens, high-speed Wi-Fi, and kitchen and bath essentials—everything you need for an exceptional stay. Our concierge is available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay. There's plenty to offer within walking distance. Try out Exchequer Restaurant & Pub or Gino’s East South Loop for some of Chicago's best dining. For shopping, head to Roosevelt Collection Shops. To explore the rest of the city, grab the bus at State & 16th Street just a few feet away. The South Loop is a vibrant blend of downtown Chicago
neighborhood_overview: There's plenty to offer within walking distance. Try out Exchequer Restaurant & Pub or Gino’s East South Loop for some of Chicago's best dining. For shopping, head to Roosevelt Collection Shops. To explore the rest of the city, grab the bus at State & 16th Street just a few feet away. The South Loop is a vibrant blend of downtown Chicago with an emerging residential neighborhood. Alongside delicious local restaurants taking over Michigan Avenue, we've watched new businesses and highrises spring to life over the past decade. This dynamic location has quickly become one of the hottest markets in the city. Home to Chicago's largest tourist attractions, the lakefront Museum Campus and Grant Park, visitors and locals enjoy spending a day at the Adler Planetarium, Shedd Aquarium, and Field Museum.
notes: Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox and we'll be sending you detailed access information three days before your stay. If you need any help, just give us a call. The second bedroom of this Sonder is loft-style, where the walls start below the ceiling, and you must walk up 5 stairs to access this room. This Sonder offers a complimentary ROKU streaming device with Netflix as well as access to many other apps. It also includes 40+ HD basic channels. Due to nearby train tracks, you may experience some noise.
transit: There are minimal free street parking spots available. Drivers can also find paid street and parking lot options nearby, but please be mindful of street signs.
interaction: Our concierge is available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay.
house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. neighborhood_overview: The South Loop is such a dynamic mix of attractions and histories that the neighborhood tends to be seen as many different things to many different people. Consider the assorted areas that comprise the South Loop: Much of its eastern edge is encompassed by the Museum Campus, an impressive collection of cultural treasures that includes the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium. This campus sits on scenic lakefront parklands that are an extension of Grant Park. With 319 acres of green space and recreational fields, Grant Park is known as "Chicago's front yard" to locals and also plays host to major city events such as Taste of Chicago, Chicago Blues Festival and Lollapalooza.  Jutting out further into Lake Michigan is Northerly Island, a peninsula sought out by nature lovers, while along the southern edge the sports fans know Soldier Field as the stadium for the beloved Chicago Bears football team. Meeting attendees are most familiar with McCormick Place, the largest convent
notes: Restaurants: great places for breakfast, brunch, sushi, burgers, pizza and beer. Cute local bars. Only a 10-12 min cab ride from the West Loop neighborhood which offers some of the best well known restaurants and bars in Chicago with world renowed chefs. Grocery Store: Jewel, Trader Joe's and Whole foods is nearby. Giordano's & Lou Malanti's: the two best places to eat pizza in Chicago are 5 minuets away Northerly Island: 15 minute walk planetarium, aquarium, field museum and Solider  Sox Park: 15 minute train ride.  Wrigleyville : 30 minute train ride Shopping: Magnificent Mile on Michigan avenue is a 10 min bus ride/bike rise away. Major Attractions are close by: All these attractions are accessible by walking/bike ride/bus/train  The bus stop is right in front of my condo.  The red line & green line train is an 8-minute walk from the condo Millennium Park: a beautiful 20 min walk through grant park, gardens and the Art Museum Navy Pier: 15-minute bus ride, 20-minute bike ride, 30/45
transit: Uber: Available within 1-2 minutes Train station: 3 minute walk Bus CTA: Directly outside the building Divvy Bike: 1/2 a block away

name: ★Private Room CLOSE to Downtown & McCormick Place★
summary: Welcome to the South Loop of Chicago! This is a newly remodeled condo with all new furniture. The location is great if you want to enjoy the city and avoid the high living cost meanwhile. Our condo is within walking's distance to Chinatown, Soldier Field, McCormick Place and Museum Campus . Walkable to Red and Green lines to downtown. You will have a private bedroom with a TV and a private bathroom (across the hallway). Please note that you must be dog-friendly since we have a lovely dog.
space: This is a newly remodeled luxury two bedroom condo. You will have entire access to the guest room. Your private bathroom with shower will be just across the hallway. We will provide WiFi, clean bed essentials and a TV with Amazon prime video. Also you will have a work station in your bedroom. In the bathroom, we will also provide all bath essential like shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, and clean towels. We have a two years Labrador baby. He is both potty trained and crate trained. He is super friendly and sweet. He is 65 lbs and might like to jump on you. He still behaves like a baby sometimes at his age. If you are scared of dog please find another suitable place. Cookie also sheds a lot although I vacuum everyday but you will still see dog hair on the floor. If you are allergic to dog hair or you are uncomfortable with that I absolutely understand, but I would not recommend you renting the place.  Some guests complained there was noise during the night, if you are a very light sleep

neighborhood_overview: The South Loop is such a dynamic mix of attractions and histories that the neighborhood tends to be seen as many different things to many different people. Consider the assorted areas that comprise the South Loop: Much of its eastern edge is encompassed by the Museum Campus, an impressive collection of cultural treasures that includes the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium. This campus sits on scenic lakefront parklands that are an extension of Grant Park. With 319 acres of green space and recreational fields, Grant Park is known as "Chicago's front yard" to locals and also plays host to major city events such as Taste of Chicago, Chicago Blues Festival and Lollapalooza.  Jutting out further into Lake Michigan is Northerly Island, a peninsula sought out by nature lovers, while along the southern edge the sports fans know Soldier Field as the stadium for the beloved Chicago Bears football team. Meeting attendees are most familiar with McCormick Place, the largest convent

summary: Wake up to the sights and sounds of Lake Michigan at this bright, stylish, and eclectic loft with large windows, plush beds, and exposed concrete. Settle down on the velvet sofa with a travel guide and plan the next day's adventures.
space: Designed with the traveler in mind, this Cirro Suite provides a lavish spread of luxurious amenities in a spacious layout. Featuring two master bedrooms and ambient decor, the Parker Suite is ready to be your modern oasis above the beautiful Chicago skyline! Cirro suites offer a unique experience that caters to tranquility and comfort and are tailored to meet the needs of each visitor. Each bedroom awaits to enfold you with soft, white linens, a memory foam mattress, and plush guest robes. Each bathroom is ready to cleanse you with organic soaps and Turkish cotton towels. The highest of three status levels, Cirro suites gives you the exquisite Chicago experience you deserve. At a Glance * Luxury white cotton linens (sheets, robes, towels)  * Puracy™ organic bath and body products * Salon professional-grade hair dryer * Two 55-inch 4K TV’s and sound bars (living room and bedroom) * High-speed WiFi  * Amazon Echo * Electronic safe * Nespresso coffee maker w/ Nespresso pods *Indoor parkin

For security purposes, we require all guests to provide an ID verification, license, or passport before check-in.  Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds.  Check-in time is any time after 4 P.M. Check-out time is any time before 11 a.m. If an earlier check-in or a later check-out time is desired, then you can send us a request. However, this is not guaranteed. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine.  Our locations do not allow pets.  No parties of any kind are allowed in the unit. This campus sits on scenic lakefront parklands that are an extension of Grant Park. With 319 acres of green space and recreational fields, Grant Park is known as "Chicago's front yard" to locals and also plays host to major city events such as Taste of Chicago, Chicago Blues Festival and Lollapalooza. summary: The penthouse of a gorgeous vintage building. This huge loft is situated perfectly in the South Loop neighborhood.  Walk to the lake, Soldier Field, McCormick Place, Grant Park, Museum Campus, Chinatown. 10min walk to the “L” Train Station or the Metra. Living Room with panoramic views. Free on-site private garage parking space.

neighborhood_overview: This huge loft is situated perfectly in the Chicago South Loop neighborhood.  Walk to the lake front and marina/ Notherly Island, Museum Campus, Soldier Field, McCormick Place, Grant Park and the Loop, Chinatown. 10min walk to the “L” Train Stations or the Metra.
notes: Like most apartments in Chicago’s loop the “L” train tracks run nearby.  Trains run from the early morning until past midnight and can create some noise. We like to think of it as local charm.
transit: We are less than a 10-minute walk/ 3 minutes cab ride from the “L” Train Roosevelt Station. By car, we are 5 minutes from the I-90/94's exit "Roosevelt Rd” or “18th St" (Eastbound only).  Uber/ Lyft, and Divvy Bike are some of the best ways to get around town. The bike station is right around the corner. (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Spring-fall you can also catch the water taxi near Chinatown which takes you on a scenic route via the Chicago River to the heart of Chicago’s river walk.
access: Entire apartment; private elevator vestibule; garage and parking lot.
house_rules: 1) Check-in is at 3pm, and check-out is by noon. Please send us a message via Airbnb App or phone when you checked out. 2) As a consideration to our neighbors, please keep things on the quieter side after 10pm. 3) To ensure full safety of our guest’s and our belongings, it is important to keep all doors closed, and locked at all time as a precautionary measure. 4) No unapproved additional guests are allowed in the apartment. We may require valid government ID/Passports to be presented to obtain access to the unit. If you have guests under the age of 18, please ensure that they are accompanied by a parent or guardian at all time while in the apartment. 5) Activities such as illegal drugs using, prostitution, assigning or subletting without permissions are strictly forbidden. 6) Group social gathering, event, and party are strictly prohibited without written approval. 7) In order to keep the apartment’s cleanness, we have a no pet and no smoking policy, although you are welcome to smoke

name: Unique 2BR in South Loop by Sonder
summary: At this Sonder, you'll love the modern decor, beautifully exposed brick, and fully-equipped kitchen. Located in the South Loop, a short walk from the Roosevelt station and Chicago's famous Museum Campus.
space: Every booking is instantly confirmed. Every call or message is answered within minutes. Every home is equipped with crisp linens, high-speed Wi-Fi, and kitchen and bath essentials—everything you need for an exceptional stay.
description: At this Sonder, you'll love the modern decor, beautifully exposed brick, and fully-equipped kitchen. Located in the South Loop, a short walk from the Roosevelt station and Chicago's famous Museum Campus. Every booking is instantly confirmed. Every call or message is answered within minutes. Every home is equipped with crisp linens, high-speed Wi-Fi, and kitchen and bath essentials—everything you need for an exceptional stay. Our concierge is available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay. There's plenty to offer within walking distance. Try out Exchequer Restaurant & Pub or Gino’s East South Loop for some of Chicago's best dining. For shopping, head to Roosevelt Collection Shops. To explore the rest of the city, grab the bus at State & 16th Street just a few feet away. The South Loop is a vibrant blend of downtown Chicago with an emerging resi
neighborhood_overview: There's plenty to offer within walking distance. Try out Exchequer Restaurant & Pub or Gino’s East South Loop for some of Chicago's best dining. For shopping, head to Roosevelt Collection Shops. To explore the rest of the city, grab the bus at State & 16th Street just a few feet away. The South Loop is a vibrant blend of downtown Chicago with an emerging residential neighborhood. Alongside delicious local restaurants taking over Michigan Avenue, we've watched new businesses and highrises spring to life over the past decade. This dynamic location has quickly become one of the hottest markets in the city. Home to Chicago's largest tourist attractions, the lakefront Museum Campus and Grant Park, visitors and locals enjoy spending a day at the Adler Planetarium, Shedd Aquarium, and Field Museum.
notes: Vacation Rental License No.: R (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)  Due to new development, you may encounter some construction that may be audible from your Sonder during business hours from 8:00AM to 4:30PM. Due to nearby train tracks, you may experience some noise. The second bedroom of this Sonder is loft-style, where the walls start below the ceiling, and you must walk up 5 stairs to access this room. This Sonder offers a complimentary ROKU streaming device with Netflix as well as access to many other apps. It also includes 40+ HD basic channels. Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox and we'll be sending you detailed access information three days before your stay. If you need any help, just give us a call.
transit: There are minimal free street parking spots available. Drivers can also find paid street and parking lot options nearby, but please be mindful of street signs.
interaction: Our concierge is available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay.
house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. It may be possible to obtain permission to host a party; contact our team to learn more.  7. If a location is lef
host_about:
Sonder provides everything you need for an exceptional stay. Every booking is instantly confirmed. Every call or message is answered within minutes. Every home is equipped with crisp linens, high-speed Wi-Fi, and kitchen and bath essentials. And every experience is one-of-a-kind, thanks to our unique spaces and Neighborhood Guides.

To provide a better Sonder guest experience, we're creating local Airbnb accounts. If you don't see a property you like here, there may be more on one of our new local profiles:

neighborhood_overview: The South Loop is such a dynamic mix of attractions and histories that the neighborhood tends to be seen as many different things to many different people. Consider the assorted areas that comprise the South Loop: Much of its eastern edge is encompassed by the Museum Campus, an impressive collection of cultural treasures that includes the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium. This campus sits on scenic lakefront parklands that are an extension of Grant Park. With 319 acres of green space and recreational fields, Grant Park is known as "Chicago's front yard" to locals and also plays host to major city events such as Taste of Chicago, Chicago Blues Festival and Lollapalooza.  Jutting out further into Lake Michigan is Northerly Island, a peninsula sought out by nature lovers, while along the southern edge the sports fans know Soldier Field as the stadium for the beloved Chicago Bears football team. Meeting attendees are most familiar with McCormick Place, the largest convent
notes: Restaurants: great places for breakfast, brunch, sushi, burgers, pizza and beer. Cute local bars. Only a 10-12 min cab ride from the West Loop neighborhood which offers some of the best well known restaurants and bars in Chicago with world renowed chefs. Grocery Store: Jewel, Trader Joe's and Whole foods is nearby. Giordano's & Lou Malanti's: the two best places to eat pizza in Chicago are 5 minuets away Northerly Island: 15 minute walk planetarium, aquarium, field museum and Solider  Sox Park: 15 minute train ride.  Wrigleyville : 30 minute train ride Shopping: Magnificent Mile on Michigan avenue is a 10 min bus ride/bike rise away. Major Attractions are close by: All these attractions are accessible by walking/bike ride/bus/train  The bus stop is right in front of my condo.  The red line & green line train is an 8-minute walk from the condo Millennium Park: a beautiful 20 min walk through grant park, gardens and the Art Museum Navy Pier: 15-minute bus ride, 20-minute bike ride, 30/45

Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds.  Check-in time is any time after 4 P.M. Check-out time is any time before 11 a.m. If an earlier check-in or a later check-out time is desired, then you can send us a request. However, this is not guaranteed. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $500 fine.  Our locations do not allow pets.  No parties of any kind are allowed unless explicitly approved by a Cloud9 team member. host_about:

The bus stop is right in front of my door, or you can walk to McCormick place, or walk to the loop, or for a couple of dollars just order an Uber or hail a Taxi. I'm a few blocks to Soldier Field, the lake, and the Museum Campus.

My Chicago condo is upscale and your experience will be above and beyond the usual AirBnB experience.  Clean, crisp white sheets, towels, and custom bathroom soaps and lotions will welcome you home, morning coffee will help you get going in the morning.   My condo is not over crowded, everything in the place is meant for you to use, and that includes the wifi, HDTV, DVR, Netflix.

Millenium Park, Grant Park, The Art Institute, Field Museum, Sears Tower, Soldier Field are all a short uber or bus ride away.
space: 2 bed rooms and our building is pet friendly!  Includes wifi, cable (HBO), blue tooth speaker, and other comforting amenities.

name: Spectacular Luxury Hideaway in Downtown Chicago!
summary: Spectacular Luxury Hideaway in Downtown Chicago!  Enjoy Chicago from this beautiful two bedroom apartment centrally located on Michigan Ave!  A short distance away from all the best Chicago attractions: Solider Field, Museum Campus, Grant Park, and many more attractions Chicago has to offer!   In/out outdoor parking located 2 blocks away at ~$20-$30/day is available to book on SpotHero (a super convenient parking app).
space: This is my personal home so you will find everything you need to make your stay conformable. My apartment is in a quiet building - the perfect place to relax after a long day of sightseeing or working!

interaction: You will have the space all to yourself. I can be reached by text, Airbnb message, or phone if you need anything.
house_rules: - NO SMOKING in the building, including in the unit or balcony - a $200 charge will be assessed for smoking (of ANY kind) - Please take off your shoes inside the unit, especially the bedrooms!  - Quiet hours after 10pm - No parties, gatherings or unregistered guests in the unit  - Lost key charge--$50 per key; Lost fob charge--$70  - Unapproved late check out will incur a $50 fee per hour.
host_about:
I moved to Chicago a few years back to "go to school" and never left!  I love how this city seems to pour itself onto the streets for every nice day from April-November, and then seems to hibernate for a few months to do it all over again.  

As a Midwesterner, I appreciate that folks here are friendly, and you can find people, culture and food from all over the planet.

I love to travel, appreciate meeting folks from all over this great big world and am grateful to be a part of the Airbnb community!

name: 2BR South Loop Luxury Suite No.1 by Zencity
summary: With quick access to McCormick Place, the Museum Campus, and The Loop, this luxury suite is ideally located for first-timers discovering this vibrant city and for regular visitors who want the easiest access to all of their favorite haunts.
space: This modern loft apartment features high ceilings, oversized windows, and handcrafted living spaces, making it the perfect place to unwind after a day of sightseeing. Lounge on the private outdoor terrace or head to the rooftop pool deck for a stunning view of this iconic city. This two bedroom home includes two bathrooms, an open-concept kitchen, spacious living room, and private outdoor terrace. The unit accommodates up to 5 guests with comfy Queen size beds and additional sleeping space on the living room couch. Building amenities include a rooftop pool deck, 24-hour fitness center with Peloton bikes, business center, and Pressbox dry cleaning lockers.

neighborhood_overview: The South Loop is such a dynamic mix of attractions and histories that the neighborhood tends to be seen as many different things to many different people. Consider the assorted areas that comprise the South Loop: Much of its eastern edge is encompassed by the Museum Campus, an impressive collection of cultural treasures that includes the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium. This campus sits on scenic lakefront parklands that are an extension of Grant Park. With 319 acres of green space and recreational fields, Grant Park is known as "Chicago's front yard" to locals and also plays host to major city events such as Taste of Chicago, Chicago Blues Festival and Lollapalooza.  Jutting out further into Lake Michigan is Northerly Island, a peninsula sought out by nature lovers, while along the southern edge the sports fans know Soldier Field as the stadium for the beloved Chicago Bears football team. Meeting attendees are most familiar with McCormick Place, the largest convent
notes: Restaurants: great places for breakfast, brunch, sushi, burgers, pizza and beer. Cute local bars. Only a 10-12 min cab ride from the West Loop neighborhood which offers some of the best well known restaurants and bars in Chicago with world renowed chefs. Grocery Store: Jewel, Trader Joe's and Whole foods is nearby. Giordano's & Lou Malanti's: the two best places to eat pizza in Chicago are 5 minuets away Northerly Island: 15 minute walk planetarium, aquarium, field museum and Solider  Sox Park: 15 minute train ride.  Wrigleyville : 30 minute train ride Shopping: Magnificent Mile on Michigan avenue is a 10 min bus ride/bike rise away. Major Attractions are close by: All these attractions are accessible by walking/bike ride/bus/train  The bus stop is right in front of my condo.  The red line & green line train is an 8-minute walk from the condo Millennium Park: a beautiful 20 min walk through grant park, gardens and the Art Museum Navy Pier: 15-minute bus ride, 20-minute bike ride, 30/45
transit: Uber: Available within 1-2 minutes Train station: 3 minute walk Bus CTA: Directly outside the building Divvy Bike: 1/2 a block away

name: 99 Steps to McCormick Place~plus indoor parking
summary: Hip, urban timber loft-steps from the world's largest convention center and new Wintrust Arena. Space features soaring 16' one hundred year old wood-beamed ceiling, cozy fireplace and a wall of windows for fabulous afternoon sun. Private bedroom (walls are not full ceiling height) with 50" television, in-unit washer/dryer, cooks kitchen and indoor parking. Ethno-chic decor with handcrafted accessories from around the world. Free wi-fi and Directv. Walk to "L" train. Spread out, relax and enjoy!
space: Due to the nature of timber ceilings there is the possibility of some sound transmission from the unit above.

host_about:
I am a real estate broker/entrepreneur/mom.  Born and raised Chicago, I have passion for the city and it's central neighborhoods.  My career has been a combination of visual design, architecture, residential real estate and event planning.  All of my strengths fuse when I prepare for your visit!

On a personal note, I enjoy reading, art, food and fitness.  Annually, I participate in the AvonWalk for Breast Cancer raising money for research and treatment (I have funded over 100 mammograms)!  I also enjoy traveling with my two daughters- this year we hope to visit Mexico, South Africa and Barcelona!! 

When I host, I strive to achieve a hotel level of amenities and comfort.  I hope you agree!!

Pam

name: Reggies Condo in Hot South Loop  2 bedroom, unit 2
summary: 2 bedroom cozy condo located in the hot South Loop area. Next door to the famous Reggies Rock Club, a live music venue with multiple bars and restaurant, just a block and a half from chinatown, 3 blocks from the new Wintrust arena, 5 blocks from McCormick place, and a free shuttle from Reggies away from Soldier Field events and other concerts/events. 2 seperate 2 bedroom units available in the same building, see other listing.
space: This is a brand new contemporary condo, all new appliances and furniture, and has everything you need during your stay. It is super plush and cozy, plenty of seating on oversized furniture, plenty of extra pillows and blankets, and extra sleeping arangements including a fold down futon in the living room, and a huge sectional that would be comfy for 2. Pots, pans, dishes and utensils are all there for you to cook a meal if you like, but there are also great restaurant options, open late, just downstairs and next door. Please keep in mind this is a multi-unit building, and we need to be respectful of our neighbors, so no parties are allowed, no smoking, and no pets.

Please keep in mind this is a multi-unit buil
neighborhood_overview: Great location in the South loop, one of the hottest growing neighborhoods in the city for events, restaurants, the bar scene, conventions, and night life. 1.5 blacks from Chinatown, 3 blocks from the new Wintrust Arena, 5 blocks from McCormick Place and  Soldier Field, and less than 10 min to Northerly Island, Grant Park, Shedd Aquarium, Adler Planetarium, and beaches. Reggies also has free shuttles to all sports games and big concerts! Also very easy to get anywhere in Chicago on public transportation, a green line stop is right behind the building and red line is 1 block away.
notes: * check in time is 4 p.m. Early check-in is not possible unless agreed upon at least one day in advance, we need time to clean the condos after the other guests check out. Luggage may be dropped off next door earlier if need be. *check out time is noon. No exceptions, unless agreed upon at least one day in advance. Again, luggage may be left next door if you have a later flight. * no smoking, no pets, no exceptions * please keep in mind these condos are next door to Reggies Rock Club. You may be able to hear the live music or the patrons from next door until 2am, but the mornings are very quiet. Unit 2 (this unit) is a bit further away than the others, so it rarely is an issue.
transit: Divvy bike rentals. Private parking for your auto in back for additional fee ($20 per night) Parking in front pay meters ($2 per hour till 10pm, free Sundays) some nearby streets have free parking. Great location for public transportation, with a green line L stop right behind the building, and a red line L stop 1 block away. There are also may taxis and ubers in the area at all times, and free shuttle rides from Reggies to Soldier Field events, and other concerts and big events. Or just walk to the plethora of options nearby!
access: You have the entire condo to use. You may also use the outside deck, which is shared among all the condos.
interaction: There is always someone right next door at Reggies that can help you with anything you might need. We respond to messages pretty much 24/7.
host_about: One day at a time...

neighborhood_overview: The South Loop is such a dynamic mix of attractions and histories that the neighborhood tends to be seen as many different things to many different people. Consider the assorted areas that comprise the South Loop: Much of its eastern edge is encompassed by the Museum Campus, an impressive collection of cultural treasures that includes the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium. This campus sits on scenic lakefront parklands that are an extension of Grant Park. With 319 acres of green space and recreational fields, Grant Park is known as "Chicago's front yard" to locals and also plays host to major city events such as Taste of Chicago, Chicago Blues Festival and Lollapalooza.  Jutting out further into Lake Michigan is Northerly Island, a peninsula sought out by nature lovers, while along the southern edge the sports fans know Soldier Field as the stadium for the beloved Chicago Bears football team. space: McCormick Place. The Lake Shore path for biking, running, or walking is accessible just two blocks south or four blocks north. neighborhood_overview: The South Loop lies, well, just south of the Chicago Loop. That makes it one of the most accessible and easy-to-find neighborhoods in the city. Bordered by the lake and gorgeous Chicago parks, the Chicago River, Chinatown, some of the top Chicago museums and McCormick Place, the South Loop should feel more bustling than it is. In reality, the 'hood is a quieter residential area ripe for exploration just a walk from downtown. There's fantastic food to be had, from white-tablecloth artistry to snappy hot dogs. Shop for books in historic Printers Row. When the sun sets, slip into one of the many hopping music hotspots, as this has long been a hub for jazz, blues and soul. Here's what to do in the South Loop. The South Loop got a little easier to access recently, when the Cermak-McCormick Green Line stop opened. Now, it takes less time to get to Acadia, one of the best fine dining restaurants in Chicago (and which also serves a killer lobster roll), as well as newcomer Spoke & Bird, a cozy

neighborhood_overview: The South Loop is one of Chicago’s biggest tourist destinations because it is home to Grant Park, which is famous for its huge outdoor summer festivals, concerts and events; and the Museum Campus is in the South Loop which houses the Shedd Aquarium, Alder Planetarium and the Field Museum. And football fans will be happy to know Soldier Field is right there, too, where the Bears play all their home games. Grant Park is a bustling hub for the city’s endless schedule of festivals and fairs, including the famous week-long Taste of Chicago when local restaurateurs set up booths to show the world just why Chicago is America’s culinary capital. Also known as “Chicago’s front yard,” this sprawling park is a popular recreational spot for Chicagoans to picnic, fly kites, take a stroll, bike, nap on the lawn, walk with the dog, read a book, listen to the iPod, or just enjoy nature at its finest.
notes: There is a mini fridge and microwave in the guest's private bedroom. However, guest are welcome to use the refrigerator and microwave in the kitchen.
transit: Public Transportation: Chicago’s public transportation literally at your doorstep plus quick, easy access to Lake Shore Drive and all of Chicago’s major highways, commuting is a breeze.  The South Loop offers direct access to both of Chicago’s major airports, with Midway about 10 miles away (via the Stevenson Expressway) and O’Hare just under 20 miles (via the Eisenhower or Kennedy Expressways). One of the most reliable ways to get to each of them, and the cheapest, is to take public transportation: •Midway: the Orange line goes directly from the Roosevelt Road station to the terminal. •O’Hare: the Blue line goes directly to the terminal. Depending on where you’re located, options for getting to the Blue line include taking the Red line into the Loop and transferring, and taking the #62/Archer bus to the Jackson station or the #29/State St bus to the Washington (Block 37) station. The South Loop’s central location offers easy access to both train and bus stations: •Amtrak operates out

neighborhood_overview: ABOUT SOUTH LOOP The South Loop is such a dynamic mix of attractions and histories that the neighborhood tends to be seen as many different things to many different people. Consider the assorted areas that comprise the South Loop: Much of its eastern edge is encompassed by the Museum Campus, an impressive collection of cultural treasures that includes the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium. This campus sits on scenic lakefront parklands that are an extension of Grant Park. With 319 acres of green space and recreational fields, Grant Park is known as "Chicago's front yard" to locals and also plays host to major city events such as Taste of Chicago, Chicago Blues Festival and Lollapalooza.  Jutting out further into Lake Michigan is Northerly Island, a peninsula sought out by nature lovers, while along the southern edge the sports fans know Soldier Field as the stadium for the beloved Chicago Bears football team. Meeting attendees are most familiar with McCormick Place, th
notes: There is a market attached to the building called south loop market. There is also a market across the street called McCormick market.  Nearby restaurants -Right next to the building is a great pizza place called Pizano’s pizza & pasta. -Tapas Valencia  -Acadia  -Giordano’s -Reggie’s rock club -Opart Thai house  -Minghin cuisine  And many many more! There is also a great coffee shop right down the street called spoke and bird  All the listed museums below are less than a mile from the building only to name a few there’s a lot more! -the art institute of Chicago  -the field museum  -shedd aquarium  -Adler planetarium  -Chicago design museum
transit: You have endless options to venture out and about in the city! You can walk most places that you need too  Or pick up a divvy bike located at stations all across the city for rent there’s some right front of the CTA green line station called  Cermak & McCormick stop. Which is only a short walk maybe 2 blocks away. Then there is the red line maybe 4 blocks away which is the Chinatown stop. If you need to go to and from the airport you will take the blue line and transfer at Clark & lake stop onto the green line (Ashland) and get off at the McCormick place. There is also Uber, taxi, and zip cars.
access: Your welcome to enjoy all the amenities the building has to offer as well as the apartment and the parking garage.
interaction: Most of the time I will ask to mail you the keys ahead of your arrival (at my expense) as you will need them to access the apartment and the amenities. I only rent out the place while I am away and don’t want to keep you or my friends waiting around the lobby. However if the mailing option does not work for you we can arrange a time to meet for delivery by hand on your arrival. I will always be available 24 hours a day via text, email, or just a call away. I also provide contact details for any assistance you require or may want but please do not bother the front desk, thank you.

neighborhood_overview: We are in the South Loop, the gateway into downtown, and where most major outdoor events take place whether in the Parks (Lollapalooza, The Blues Festival, and The Taste of Chicago!), Soldier Field, and McComick Place. This is host to numerous World Class Museums, like the Field Museum and the Art Institute. If food is your scene (and we all love to eat!) literally a block away is Chinatown, the largest Asian neighbourhood in the city with foods ranging from Bubble Tea and Dim Sum to Haute Seafood Asian Fusion! A little known secret for Seafood in Chicago is that Chinatown is THE place to get the Freshest and Live Seafood in the city. And for the best value too! Also just a couple doors down is Reggie's, one of Chicago's most iconic Music Bars! Just minutes away in the neighbourhood of Pilsen you have artists galleries up and down Halsted St and a lovely Brewery (Moody Tongue) with a Fantastic Tasting Room. It's also fast becoming the city's new hot restaurant scene too! And of course
notes: ►Noise Potential◀ We are located next to the Train and McCormick Place so even though the windows are insulated you can still hear the Hustle and Bustle of the city. We do provide Earplugs if you're a light sleeper. -We do not have a designated parking spot yet. There's some free parking around our block but everything else is metered. There are some Spot Hero Spaces right behind our building. -We want to make sure that your stay exceeds your expectations... When making a request, please tell us a little about yourselves, your interest in our home and indicate that you have read the full listing and house rules... Thank you!
transit: Our flat has very quick, easy access to Major Highways, and Public Transportation taking you to major destinations within minutes. Also very close by is an entrance to Lake Shore Drive which can take you up the famous and scenic city coastline or down to Hyde Park where U of C is located and The Museum of Science and Industry. Just a block away we have the Red and Green Line Trains that can take you to every Major destinations downtown within minutes so there's no need to rent a car! We do not have a dedicated parking spot but there a few free parking spots in front of our building and around the block. There are also some free Spot Hero spots right behind the building you can rent.
access: Entire Flat
interaction: We like to Welcome all our guests but if not we are able to do 24hr Self Check In. We're foodies and are in the food industry so we'll be happy to give you our recommendations in the city!
house_rules: ~Please note that if you choose to stay with us you are also agreeing to our House Rules: -No Smoking anywhere in the building -No Parties or Events -No Guests are Permitted Outside of the Reservation -No Littering or Loud noises in Common Areas -Quiet Hours are from 10pm-8am -Please respect the neighbourhood and our neighbours by not being loud or littering. We are friends with our neighbours and value our relationships with them.  -Please take shoes off inside, it's just hygienic. ~Locals must contact us before booking Breaking of the rules will result in the forfeiture of the deposit plus any additional fees, and the removal of all guests without refund.
host_about: We're newly weds wanting to begin an adventure together. We love to travel, and eat, and eat more, and then go into food coma.

name: Comfortable Room in the South Loop
summary: Comfy private room -with ample storage- in a newly renovated condo, within a friendly gated community, in a great neighborhood, in an awesome city!!!  Plus: see above (and great room mates, plus a garden!);  Minus: you share our (pretty) bathroom and you room does not have windows.
space: First floor condo with little garden in an inner courtyard and an attached garage. The open floor plan makes this an ideal place for a person who likes people and sits at our comfy breakfast bar to chat about your day. Our house is your house, and you are welcome to use the kitchen, garage, living room and garden with us.  We have a washer-dryer combo which you are welcome to utilize, however, due to previous "flooding trauma", we like to do laundry when one of us is at home.

Plus: see above (and great room mates, plus a garden!);  Minus: you share our (pretty) bathroom and you room does not have windows. Our house is your house, and you are welcome to use the kitchen, garage, living room and garden with us. This is a gated community and there is a gate code to get in and a code for the garage (our backdoor so to speak). Once you are here we'll give you keys for the garden door. We are here for you!  My husband and I are usually in bed arou
neighborhood_overview: Love this neighborhood! You are just far enough south to be away from the tourists and get a true "I live here!" feeling. The Red Line (Chinatown/Cermak stop) will take you downtown in ten minutes; buses on Clark, State and Michigan take you north in twenty minutes. Supermarkets are within walking distance as are some fabulous restaurants and.... you guessed it... Chinatown! Our amazing lake is about ten minutes east of us via bicycle (there are Divvy rental station just about everywhere!) and the museum campus and Soldier field are also 10-15 minutes away.  In the other direction: McCormick Conference center is a five minute cab ride or 15 minutes via bicycle. It's great to be in the "S'loop"!
notes: So, three things that are NOT great:  1) there is no window in your room 2) you share the one and only bathroom with us 3) the upstairs unit's staircase to the garage is 'behind' your room and you do hear them come down in the morning
transit: Buses 24, 29, 62 are right in front of our door.  Five minutes walk away is the El train, the red line, which will get you south to the Sox Stadium in five minutes (next stop) or north to downtown in ten or to Andersonville in twenty. There are Divvy rental bike stations close by and all over the city. We park our motorcycles in our garage, but if you have a car, we'll organize parking within our complex for you at no cost.
access: This is a gated community and there is a gate code to get in and a code for the garage (our backdoor so to speak). Once you are here we'll give you keys for the garden door.
interaction: We are here for you!  My husband and I are usually in bed around 10-11 pm and up between 6-7 am. I am happy to set the coffee maker for your cup o' joe in the morning... :) We often watch telly in the evening in the living room - feel free to join us (NCIS anyone?!) or watch Netflix in the comfort of your room. I like cooking and you are welcome to either share a meal with us or enjoy leftovers the next day. We also are firm believers in the second “B” in “Airbnb” - so whether we simply purchase your favorite cereal or you eat scrambled eggs with us at 7am - breakfast or breakfast items are provided!
house_rules: Please don't smoke. Anywhere. Ever. Thanks! We are also a "no shoes house". Quiet time between 10pm-7am. While we don't allow overnight guests, feel free to host new friends for drinks & nibbles at our place. Just give us a heads-up. There isn't space for a vehicle in the garage, but we can arrange outside parking in our complex for you. And you can store "stuff" in the garage... As mentioned above: don't run the washer without supervision (that's YOU supervising the washer, not US supervising you....!) We are very easy going. Let us know what you want, need, prefer - and we'll make it happen!
host_about:
“Do not neglect hospitality, for through it some have unknowingly entertained angels.”
-Hebrews 13:2-

I am a fun and funny (yes, even though I am German....go figure!) person, who loves life and people.
 
My career in hotel business has provided hours of entertaining stories and experience... Growing up with two older sisters, I got stuck with their music - I love my Classic Rock and will see "Rush" anytime they play in my city. 

My German roots and my family over there are very important to me, as is my Catholic upbringing, but my love for THIS country rules, and I fulfilled a childhood dream by living here... 

I've lived in fabulous cities and made amazing friends along the way - I bet I have a story or two to share...

What else?! I've ran the Chicago Marathon in '11, motorcycled through Canada in '15, I like boxing and kayaking, bicycling and seriously hanging out on my couch with a good book or a great movie. 

I can also cook decently and love feeding and entertaining people, and I like heavy, dark wines and Macallan scotch. 
My husband and I like watching Netflix together and you are always welcome to join us. 

What about you!?
