name: Private Room loft near downtown, Mccormick Place
summary: Your private bedroom in our industrial loft in Chicago's South Loop Neighborhood. Close to Chinatown, CTA Green and Redline trains, and Museums. State street and Michigan Avenue buses makes a quick trip to most tourist attractions and shopping.  Exposed brick, natural light in a former auto parts warehouse.  The listing is for a private bedroom, we live in the loft with our French bulldogs.  If you do not like dogs or want to pet them this may not be the best Airbnb for your needs.
space: The bedroom listed is private while the bathroom, kitchen and common areas are used by my husband and I who live in the loft as well.  Tea is provided along with a small refrigerator, blow dryer, towels and toiletries.  Exposed bricks and a retro decor make our warehouse loft one of a kind.   We have two French Bulldogs who will be home during your stay as well.  These dogs are a part of our family and really love attention from people.  If you do not prefer to be around dogs, and do not plan on petting them and showing them some love this may not be the best Airbnb for your needs.  The dogs love and demand attention from our guests.   NO ELEVAOTR ON SITE, 2 FLIGHTS OF STAIRS FOR LOFT ACCESS

State street and Michigan Avenue buses makes a quick trip to most tourist attractions and shopping.  Exposed brick, natural light in a former auto parts warehouse.  The listing is for a private bedroom, we live in the loft with our French bulldogs.  If you do not like dogs or want to pet them this may not be the best Airbnb for your needs. The bedroom listed is private while the bathroom, kitchen and common areas are used by my husband and I who live in the loft as well.  Tea is provided along with a small refrigerator, blow dryer, towels and toiletries.  Exposed bricks and a retro decor make our warehouse loft one of a kind.   We have two French Bulldogs who will be home during your stay as well.  These dogs are a part of our family and really love attention from people.  If you do not prefer to be around dogs, and do not plan on petting them
neighborhood_overview: Please view the listing guidebook for some area attractions we frequent.  The South Loop is just a few minutes south of Downtown, near Soldier Field, Chinatown and Mccormick Place.  We are just a few minutes from most popular tourist destinations and have many public transit options right around the corner.   Chicago Museums are a 10min walk from the front door and Michigan Ave shopping is a short train or Lyft away.  The neighborhood was once known as Motor Row and was home to many car dealerships and vehicle associations.  Our loft was once an auto parts warehouse many, many years ago.   Our home is  very close to Mccormick place, Northerly Island, Chinatown, Pilsen and downtown making it a very accessible and convenient location for all. Nearby restaurants include: Reggies Rock Bar, Windy City BBQ, Jamaican Jerk Chicken Villa, Opart Thai, Burger Pointe, Pizano's Pizza, Cafe Bionda and Spoke and Bird to name a few.
notes: There are two flights of stairs leading up to our loft, no elevator on site. Also expect typical amounts of city street noise. Again, the common areas such as bathroom and kitchen are shared with us and we have 2 French Bulldogs.
transit: We are two blocks from the Mccormick Place Green line station and four blocks from the Chinatown redline station.  Buses that run down State St and Michigan Ave. are one block away and there are Divvy bike shares on the corner.  On foot walking to the museums and millennium park will take 25-30mins. Michigan Ave shopping is 10mins away by train as are most other downtown attractions like Navy Pier.
access: If you are not comfortable around dogs his will not be the best place for your needs. While you are here you can use the common areas as much or as little as you want. You will receive one set of keys and may come and go as needed, no restrictions on time.   There is a large living area and kitchen you are welcome to sit to eat and relax and enjoy our home.  The bathroom is shared with us but we have flexible schedules and are pretty easy going and able to accommodate most schedules.  If separate sleeping spaces are needed let us know and we can provide an additional air bed as well.
interaction: Each guest is different and prefers a different amount of socializing.  We will always be available to say hello and chat but understand if you prefer to spend your time in the bedroom on your own.  We provide Netflix for this very reason!   We are always available by text or message if you need anything at all during your stay.
house_rules: Check In times are flexible, check out is 10am, luggage storage is available. This is a private room with shared bathroom and kitchen.  We have two French Bulldogs, who love people.  If you do not appreciate dogs please look for other accommodations.
host_about:
Christopher and I have lived in Chicago for ten years, both from the midwest originally.  Christopher has had the chance to travel the world and I hope to do so soon as well.  My favorite part about Air BnB is meeting people from all over the world. 

We are both active and creative people.  We love cycling (on a tandem bike and solo), photography movies and outdoor activities.   I am a massage therapist at a luxury hotel and Christopher is a visual artist, he actually did all of the decorating in our home which many people find surprising. 
We are also animal lovers and have 2 French Bulldogs. 

We have been hosting on Air BnB for over four years now.  The one thing we have learned is that each guest is different and has different expectations and needs.  If you are the more social type feel free to hang out and tell us about yourself and your day.. If you prefer to spend time on your own in your room we won't bother you at all.  We want you to enjoy your time in Chicago.

neighborhood_overview: The South Loop / Downtown neighborhood is home to many famous venues, destinations, and business hubs. The South Loop is such a dynamic mix of attractions and histories that the neighborhood tends to be seen as many different things to many different people. Consider the assorted areas that comprise the South Loop: Much of its eastern edge is encompassed by the Museum Campus, an impressive collection of cultural treasures that includes the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium. This campus sits on scenic lakefront parklands that are an extension of Grant Park. With 319 acres of green space and recreational fields, Grant Park is known as "Chicago's front yard" to locals and also plays host to major city events such as Taste of Chicago, Chicago Blues Festival and Lollapalooza. Jutting out further into Lake Michigan is Northerly Island, a peninsula sought out by nature lovers, while along the southern edge the sports fans know Soldier Field as the stadium for the beloved Chic
notes: Parking is available for an additional charge. Please ask for details.
transit: We're located in the South Loop with CTA Bus/"L" access (Red, Green, and Orange Line, Bus #29 State, and Bus #62 Archer) right outside your door. Roosevelt CTA and subway station is just a block away. Easy access to Interstates 55 and 95 give you the easy access to quick travel around Chicago for your commute.
access: This spacious 1200 sq ft  2 bedroom penthouse is on the 22nd floor of a high-rise located in the South Loop neighborhood of downtown Chicago. It is a safe neighborhood and there is a doorman 24/7.
interaction: I will be present at your check-in unless I am out of town and I am always available via my personal phone 24/7 should you encounter any problems or simply need recommendations for dinner.
house_rules: No professional photography or photo sessions  in a building. No Smoking.  No guests are allowed in the unit during your reservation aside from those that are part of the reservation and will be staying overnight.  You will be charged $50/person per night for any guests that enter the unit that are not on the reservation.
host_about: I love hosting people in my beautiful place. Chicago is one of the most fascinating cities in the world and I am happy I can contribute to your experience of it. I love to travel myself and learn new languages and new cultures.

neighborhood_overview: The South Loop is such a dynamic mix of attractions and histories that the neighborhood tends to be seen as many different things to many different people. Consider the assorted areas that comprise the South Loop: Much of its eastern edge is encompassed by the Museum Campus, an impressive collection of cultural treasures that includes the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium. This campus sits on scenic lakefront parklands that are an extension of Grant Park. With 319 acres of green space and recreational fields, Grant Park is known as "Chicago's front yard" to locals and also plays host to major city events such as Taste of Chicago, Chicago Blues Festival and Lollapalooza.  Jutting out further into Lake Michigan is Northerly Island, a peninsula sought out by nature lovers, while along the southern edge the sports fans know Soldier Field as the stadium for the beloved Chicago Bears football team. Meeting attendees are most familiar with McCormick Place, the largest convent
transit: You are only a 2 minute walk from the Green Line Subway stop, which gets you virtually everywhere in the City. You are also a short walk to a number of restaurants and attractions
access: With your key fob, guests have access to the suite, rooftop, gym, amenities, and washer/dryer
interaction: We are here to help, but give you space to enjoy!

host_about:
I moved to Chicago a few years back to "go to school" and never left!  I love how this city seems to pour itself onto the streets for every nice day from April-November, and then seems to hibernate for a few months to do it all over again.  

As a Midwesterner, I appreciate that folks here are friendly, and you can find people, culture and food from all over the planet.

I love to travel, appreciate meeting folks from all over this great big world and am grateful to be a part of the Airbnb community!

house_rules: All bookings require a security deposit of $500 or more. This deposit will not be charged in advance. For security purposes, we require all guests to provide an ID verification, license, or passport before check-in.  Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds.  Check-in time is any time after 4 P.M. Check-out time is any time before 11 a.m. If an earlier check-in or a later check-out time is desired, then you can send us a request. However, this is not guaranteed. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine.  Our locations do not allow pets.  No parties of any kind are allowed in the unit. If a location is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $50 for every extra hour of cleaning required.  Guests are not allowed to book a stay in their city of residence

My goal is to have all my guests have a comfortable stay here in my apartments.  I've traveled quite a bit and still love to when the opportunity presents itself. These days though, I seem to do a lot more hosting than traveling. We design spaces and host corporate clients. 

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

neighborhood_overview: Much of the South Loop's eastern edge is encompassed by the Museum Campus, an impressive collection of cultural treasures that includes the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium. This campus sits on scenic lakefront parklands that are an extension of Grant Park. With 319 acres of green space and recreational fields, Grant Park is known as "Chicago's front yard" to locals and also plays host to major city events such as Taste of Chicago, Chicago Blues Festival and Lollapalooza. More information Just off the Lake Michigan shoreline is Northerly Island, a peninsula sought out by nature lovers, while along the southern edge the sports fans know Soldier Field as the stadium for the beloved Chicago Bears football team. Meeting attendees are most familiar with McCormick Place, the largest convention center in the country and concert goers can enjoy a night out at The Wintrust arena both places are just a 5 min car ride or short walk.
notes: -Ample paid street parking is available for short-term parking -Off street 24 hour in/out garage parking is also available 1 block away. Please ask for details.  -Early check-in $35 or free bag drop-off (when available)  -Safe/walkable area near all public transportation, restaurants, grocery and other attractions.

name: Reggies Condo, prime South Loop, cozy 2BR, unit 1
summary: 2 bedroom cozy condo located in the hot south loop area. Next door to the famous Reggies Rock Club, a live music venue, just a block and a half from chinatown, 3 blocks from the new Wintrust arena, 5 blocks from McCormick place, and a free Reggies shuttle away from Soldier Field events, and other concerts, sports games, and events. 2 seperate 2 bedroom units available in the same building, see other listing. This is a multi-unit building, and we need to be respectful of our neighbors.  Please read the entire listing, including house rules, check-in instructions, check in and out times, Transportation & Parking details.
space: Situated adjacent to Reggies Rock Club, this brand new contemporary South loop condo with a full kitchen has plenty of windows and a skylight in a bedroom.  All new and comfortable furniture, modern kitchen and bath finishes, extra pillows and blankets. One of the bedrooms has a queen bed , the other has a full size bed with a twin trundle underneath. There is also a comfortable full-size futon that folds down in the living room. Guests also have access to the rooftop deck.  Minutes walk to Chinatown, McCormick Place, the new Wintrust arena for DePaul basketball and concerts.  Free shuttle to all Blackhawks, Bears, and White Sox games via the Reggies bus next door.

neighborhood_overview: Great location in the South loop, one of the hottest growing neighborhoods in the city for events, restaurants, the bar scene, conventions, and night life. 1.5 blacks from Chinatown, 3 blocks from the new Wintrust Arena, 5 blocks from McCormick Place and  Soldier Field, and less than 10 min to Northerly Island, Grant Park, Shedd Aquarium, Adler Planetarium, and beaches. Reggies also has free shuttles to all sports games and big concerts! Also very easy to get anywhere in Chicago on public transportation, a green line stop is right behind the building and red line is 1 block away.
notes: Please note, Reggies has live music most nights. It is not very loud in the condo, but chances are you may be able to hear it. Please note also, check in time is after 4 p.m., no exceptions unless agreed upon in advance. Same goes for checkout, which is noon. There are check-in instructions listed, please read them. If you have an earlier flight into town, you can drop off luggage with us before check-in.
transit: Divvy bike rentals. Private parking for your auto in back for additional fee.  Parking in front pay meters. Great location for public transportation, with a green line L stop right behind the building, and a red line L stop 1 block away. There are also may taxis and ubers in the area at all times, and free shuttle rides from Reggies to Soldier Field events, and other concerts and big events. Or just walk to the plethora of options nearby!
access: Full 24 hour access to rooftop deck! This is where guests can smoke, and you are welcome to hang out, but please no loud music or partying.
interaction: We can be reached next door at Reggies from 11am til 2am virtually every day, and reached by message 24 hours a day.
house_rules: 1. NO PARTIES! NO LOUD MUSIC! Please, this is a multi-unit building, and others that live in the building enjoy their peaceful sleep. 2. NO ADDITIONAL GUESTS. The number of guests must be the amount of guests that the room was booked for. The entrances are surveillanced, and there will be an extra charge per guest. 3. Try to keep it clean. If you spill something, wipe it up. If you cook a meal, clean up the mess and put the dishes in the dishwasher. Garbage can be left in the unit, but please have it bagged up. Please treat our place as you would your own. The cleaning fee covers a basic 2 hour cleaning. If excessive cleaning is needed, there will be an extra charge. 4. Check-in is strictly at 4 p.m., and check out is at noon. There are absolutely no exceptions unless agreed upon in advance. We need this time to clean the units in between guests. Thanks.
host_about: One day at a time...

name: CUTE 2 BD, lake view, 1.5 miles to McCormick Pl!
summary: Very sunny bright 12th floor south loop condo with a lake view.  Nice walk over Roosevelt underpass to the Lake, or 18th St. footbridge to McCormick Place (1.5 Miles)!  I often get compliments on the decor.  It is much nicer than the pictures.
space: Very bright all times of the day.  Open living room and dining area.  Fully equipped kitchen and a Keurig for coffee Two full baths, one with a steam shower separate from the large bathtub and another with a bathtub and shower  Elevator close to the unit Very safe with a front desk doorman
description: Very sunny bright 12th floor south loop condo with a lake view.  Nice walk over Roosevelt underpass to the Lake, or 18th St. footbridge to McCormick Place (1.5 Miles)! summary: Brand new constructed modern beautiful 2 bed/2 full bath loft that comes with 900sf of space and amazing amenities. This apartment has everything you need for a comfortable stay. Convenient self check in / checkout! Great spot in Chicago's swanky South Loop! Steps away from McCormick & Wintrust Arena, Public Transportation, Minutes away from Grant & Millennium Parks, Soldier Field & Museum Campus. My place is ideal for business travelers and families.
space: Welcome to the beautiful city of Chi-Town! I'm ecstatic to have you as my guest and my intention is maximize your experience!! It is my pleasure to make sure you are comfortable in my home and have all your needs accommodated.  This is a modern new constructed 900 square foot fully furnished condo with two full baths, workspace and has breath-taking city views on the rooftop.  Living Room: After a full day of exploring the city, relax on the cozy sofa. High definition Smart TV with Amazon FireTV Stick which gives you access to Netflix, Pandora, Movies and more. Bedroom: Sun drench bedroom with floor to ceiling windows gives you a beautiful view of the city. Lay in bed as you watch the sun set from the bedroom. It’s a calming and serene experience! The memory foam mattress feels like you are sleeping on clouds. Plenty of down-filled pillows (4) and extra blankets. if you wish close the blinds and enjoy a lazy morning. notes: Restaurants: great places for breakfast, brunch, sushi, burgers, pizza and beer. Cute local bars. Grocery Store: Jewel, Trader Joe's and Whole foods is nearby. Giordano's & Lou Malanti's: the two best places to eat pizza in Chicago are 5 minuets away Northerly Island: 15 minute walk planetarium, aquarium, field museum and Solider  Sox Park: 15 minute train ride.  Wrigleyville : 30 minute train ride Shopping: Magnificent Mile on Michigan avenue is a 10 min bus ride/bike rise away. name: Handsome McCormick 3BD-2BA Loft
summary: Welcome to The Handsome McCormick Loft where you're just steps away from the train, relaxed nightlife, iconic restaurants and McCormick Center! This 3 bdr/2 ba comfy loft is centrally located near the heart of Chicago and perfect for business travelers looking for a great space near McCormick Center or large groups looking for a central location near all that Chicago has to offer!
space: This recently renovated 3 bdr/2 ba loft like apartment comes with 3 comfy beds, a fold out futon + an air mattress that can both accommodate one and a fully-stocked kitchen for all of your cooking desires!  There are enough towels and supplies for your entire group, along with bath essentials like shampoo, conditioner and soap The living room has a Smart TV with Roku so you can stream your favorite movies and shows on demand and we thoughtfully designed the space to give a more modern and comfy feel for you.

neighborhood_overview: Welcome to the booming South Loop of Chicago! You are: -5 mins drive from McCormick's place -5 min walk to the train down the street -Short bus ride to Museum campus -Quick jump to Soldier Field -Brewery a block away -Near Chinatown and downtown
notes: This is an apartment building so you will have neighbors. Please be respectful!  There is street parking in front of the building and along adjacent streets, but it is paid parking.
transit: The Cermak-McCormick Place train stop is just a 5 min walk down the street and is the best way to get around the city! If you have a car, downtown is just a short drive away and we are about 5 mins to the nearest major expressway, I-55 and I-90/94. Lyfts and Ubers are readily available if needed as well.
access: The guest has access to the entire apartment!
interaction: We are not on-site but are nearby if you need anything!
house_rules: • No smoking. Smoking penalty fee is $500 • No pets • No parties or events • Check-in is anytime after 4PM
host_about:
Hi, Thanks for taking a look at our special homes.

My name is Noah. A few years ago, my family and I got together to create an amazing experience for tourists and guests like you.

We are Chicagoans who love sharing our city with the world and strive to make your stay as comfortable as possible so you can enjoy the city like a local. 

We're passionate about travel. As experienced travelers, we've learned what creates a top notch experience and we're committed to sharing that experience with you. It's something we call "Sweet Home Chicago" and we hope you carry it back with you to where ever you call home! :)

You can find us hanging by the lake, catching a game at Wrigley, grabbing a drink in Wicker Park, enjoying the many concerts going on on any given night, or at any of the amazing local coffee shops across the city.

neighborhood_overview: The South Loop is such a dynamic mix of attractions and histories that the neighborhood tends to be seen as many different things to many different people. Consider the assorted areas that comprise the South Loop: Much of its eastern edge is encompassed by the Museum Campus, an impressive collection of cultural treasures that includes the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium. This campus sits on scenic lakefront parklands that are an extension of Grant Park. With 319 acres of green space and recreational fields, Grant Park is known as "Chicago's front yard" to locals and also plays host to major city events such as Taste of Chicago, Chicago Blues Festival and Lollapalooza.  Jutting out further into Lake Michigan is Northerly Island, a peninsula sought out by nature lovers, while along the southern edge the sports fans know Soldier Field as the stadium for the beloved Chicago Bears football team. Meeting attendees are most familiar with McCormick Place, the largest convent
notes: Restaurants: great places for breakfast, brunch, sushi, burgers, pizza and beer. Cute local bars. Only a 10-12 min cab ride from the West Loop neighborhood which offers some of the best well known restaurants and bars in Chicago with world renowed chefs. Grocery Store: Jewel, Trader Joe's and Whole foods is nearby. Giordano's & Lou Malanti's: the two best places to eat pizza in Chicago are 5 minuets away Northerly Island: 15 minute walk planetarium, aquarium, field museum and Solider  Sox Park: 15 minute train ride.  Wrigleyville : 30 minute train ride Shopping: Magnificent Mile on Michigan avenue is a 10 min bus ride/bike rise away. Major Attractions are close by: All these attractions are accessible by walking/bike ride/bus/train  The bus stop is right in front of my condo.  The red line & green line train is an 8-minute walk from the condo Millennium Park: a beautiful 20 min walk through grant park, gardens and the Art Museum Navy Pier: 15-minute bus ride, 20-minute bike ride, 30/45
transit: Uber: Available within 1-2 minutes Train station: 3 minute walk Bus CTA: Directly outside the building Divvy Bike: 1/2 a block away
access: You have access to the entire apartment except the hallway closet labeled "Aqueelah's Closet"

You are welcome to use the dishwasher. - Quiet time Monday thru Sunday 10p-8a - Use the squeegee after ever shower - Upon departure Place all used towels and linens in the center of the bathroom floor. - Upon departure clear all trash and take it to the Trash Chute Located in the Hallway on your  floor.

name: Chicago South Loop Bed & Bath Near Soldier Field
summary: We are an inclusive couple offering a warm, comfortable space for our guests. This private bedroom and bathroom is located in a handsome South Loop apartment building that is a quick walk to many popular destinations such as Soldier Field Stadium and Millenium Park.  Enjoy coffee, Nespresso and make-your-own continental breakfast in the morning. Walk-up apartment building with elevators, including a rooftop lounge pool and a small fitness room.
space: The bedroom includes room for your clothes in a chest of drawers, and 1/2 of the closet for hanging clothes.  In the bedroom we also provide a bluetooth music speaker and a Doterra diffuser with choice of essential oils. An iron & ironing board are available in the apartment if you need them. Wi-fi is included throughout the apartment.

Enjoy coffee, Nespresso and make-your-own continental breakfast in the morning. Walk-up apartment building with elevators, including a rooftop lounge pool and a small fitness room. Wi-fi is included throughout the apartment. You'll have a private bedroom with a full-size bed, bed linens, and a private bathroom across the hall. Basic bathroom amenities and bath linens are also included. You're welcome to make yourself breakfast, coffee
neighborhood_overview: Our apartment is an 18-minute walk to Soldier Field Stadium, and an approximately 30-minute walk to Shedd Aquarium. Millennium Park (home of the Bean sculpture) is 2 miles away - 15 minutes from the apartment by public transportation (train or bus). The CTA train (El) is about a 5-minute walk from the apartment. There is a bodega about 2.5 blocks away. Numerous restaurants, cafes and salons are within easy walking distance. There is a full grocery store available within a 9-minute walk.
transit: The train is about a 5-minute walk from the apartment.  Pay parking is often available on the street in front of the building - but is not guaranteed. Mass transit by train or bus is better in the city than driving, and parking can be very difficult and expensive downtown. Parking is NOT included with this listing, and on-street parking is NOT guaranteed.
access: You'll have a private bedroom with a full-size bed, bed linens, and a private bathroom across the hall. Basic bathroom amenities and bath linens are also included. You're welcome to make yourself breakfast, coffee or Nespresso in the mornings. You may store items in the refrigerator when space is available, and may use the microwave (except during the stated quiet hours).
interaction: While we stay busy in general with work, we are usually home in the evenings and available by text/phone as necessary. Don't hesitate to let us know if you have questions. We're here to help make your stay more enjoyable!
house_rules: - This listing is for a maximum of 2 adults. - Check-in time is 6pm. Check-out is 2pm. If you book, you are agreeing to abide by the stated check-in time of 6pm and the check-out time of 2pm. name: Parkview on Michigan
summary: My place faces Grant Park and the Museum Campus, is withing walking distance  to Chicago Symphony,  Art Institute,  McCormick convention center, Soldier Field, Millennium Park, many restaurants and shopping, all forms of public transportation. You’ll love my place. The apartment is beautiful and very spacious. The guests' part is  a suite; a full bedroom, bathroom and a separate sitting room with a sofa and a working desk. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
space: This unique, eight-story building nestled between highrises was build in the 1890s. About 16 years ago it was completely gutted on the inside and all the units were designed by individual owners, so no two places are alike.

neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood has everything. Transportation, recreation, cultural institutions, lake front, restaurants, shopping, movie theaters. Trader Joe's is downstairs, so is Burger Bar, Yoke.
notes: It's a very lovely place, easy to stay and get around.
transit: This is an ideal location - across the street from Grant Park.  CTA buses are downstairs. Red, Green and Orange(Midway) CTA trains are a block away, as well as an easy transfer to the Blue(O'Hare) line. Public parking is available next door. Almost everything is within walking distance; restaurants, shops, the Lake Front, Museums, Symphony, Soldier Field.

name: Rustic Chi-City Loft/Wintrust/McCormick
summary: My place has an open floor plan that features original brick and timber loft construction, state-of-the-art gourmet kitchen with stainless steel, quartz countertops and dark wood cabinets, hardwood-like flooring, soaring lofted ceilings, marble and tile baths, and washer/dryer.
space: Living Room: After a full day of exploring the city, relax on the cozy sectional. High definition Smart TV with Amazon FireTV Stick which gives you access to Netflix, Pandora, Movies and more. Bedroom: Queen size platform leather bed. The memory foam mattress feels like you are sleeping on clouds. Plenty of down-filled pillows (4) and extra blankets. if you wish close the blinds and enjoy a lazy morning. Kitchen: Fully stocked - Pots, pans, stemware, silverware, steak knives, cooking utensils and plates.  Breakfast: Orange juice, Bagels & Eggs provided.

neighborhood_overview: Convenient self check in / checkout! Great spot in Chicago's swanky South Loop!  Minutes away from Grant & Millennium Parks, Wintrust Arena, McCormick Place, Field Museum, Shed Aquarium, and the Planetarium. My place is also close to the train station and Soldier Field if you would like to catch a Bears game while visiting.
notes: Restaurants: great places for breakfast, brunch, sushi, burgers, pizza and beer. Cute local bars. Only a 10-12 min cab ride from the West Loop neighborhood which offers some of the best well known restaurants and bars in Chicago with world renowed chefs. Grocery Store: Jewel, Trader Joe's and Whole foods is nearby. Giordano's & Lou Malanti's: the two best places to eat pizza in Chicago are 5 minuets away Northerly Island: 15 minute walk planetarium, aquarium, field museum and Solider  Sox Park: 15 minute train ride.  Wrigleyville : 30 minute train ride Shopping: Magnificent Mile on Michigan avenue is a 10 min bus ride/bike rise away. Major Attractions are close by: All these attractions are accessible by walking/bike ride/bus/train  The bus stop is right in front of my condo.  The red line & green line train is an 5-minute walk from the condo Millennium Park: a beautiful 20 min walk through grant park, gardens and the Art Museum Navy Pier: 15-minute bus ride, 20-minute bike ride, 30/45
transit: Uber: Available within 1-2 minutes Train station: 3 minute walk Bus CTA: Directly outside the building Divvy Bike: 1/2 a block away
interaction: I'm available to accommodate your needs and make your stay an amazing one!

You are welcome to use the dishwasher.
